topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552db0f9636872424ccc2900#post_552db0f9636872424ccc2900

I'm not going to claim to be some sort of Lincoln expert, but I spent almost the entirety of a semester examining his personal documents, essays about his life, and even had to write a few of my own. It's possible that he harbored some pro-segregation beliefs early in life, but quickly changed his tune as he got older, writing about the equality of all men (expect probably Indians lololol) in journals and discussing it with his wife. But he couldn't say anything about it publicly, because saying you supported equality back in the 1800s would be political suicide. So he kept silent until he could be in a position to change things. The Civil War gave him the opportunity to release the Emancipation Proclamation under the guise of a "military tactic" (if all the slaves were trying to escape, or at least _knew_ that they could legally escape, there would be mass chaos in the South).

...this was basically a watered down version of my essays.  

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552db17c6368724fc0e20500#post_552db17c6368724fc0e20500

Definitely. 


"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552db2136368726ced1d0000#post_552db2136368726ced1d0000

I think I read about this. Like I said in my above post, he didn't really have a choice unless he wanted to never hold public office ever again, not even as a postman. Whether this was right or not is up to argument...but I think it was probably for the best. -But I could very well be thinking of something else.-

He only got to speak his mind as president because he had such strong support from a strong group of powerful peoples, and even then, he tread carefully.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552db3506368726db8780100#post_552db3506368726db8780100

So yeah, just know if anyone says that Lincoln only released slaves for political reasons, know they're full of shit. "The North wanted slaves to be free!!" is the elementary school version of history. They couldn't give less of a shit about slavery, disregarded it as a "southern issue", and might have even been _upset_ had slaves been released because Lincoln was all "muh freedums". White supremacy is a bitch.

Abolitionism really wasn't as widespread as textbooks make it seem. It just seemed bigger because of the concentration of numbers.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552db8bd63687232ce310100#post_552db8bd63687232ce310100
Also that areas that did have common slave usage were held back industrially and in other aspects wise.  The south may have put up a good fight, but they were fucked from the get go.  The problem with slavery is that the south became overly economically dependent on it so as a result that held back development in the south.

What I mean by this is look at a railroad map from the civil war.  The north could transport troops around much more easily; they could manufacture their weapons much more easily, etc etc.  During the entire war the south's plan was to try to make the war last as long as possible to drag it out and constantly be on the defensive so as to reduce the north's advantage over them. . . needless to say the plan didn't work.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
